oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHIP-BRIDGE-PIER PROTECTIVE SYSTEMS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Iwai, Akira
Nagasawa, Hitoshi
Oda, Kazuki
Shoji, Kuniaki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: shore protection
ship protection
bridge protection
pier protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes the analytical and experimental studies on the behaviors of a ship subjected to a sheering flow induced around a rectangular solid-type marine structure, and also deals with ship-structure protective systems against ship impacts. Large bridge piers, which are constructed in a narrow waterway with strong tidal currents, are treated herein as one of the typical solidtype marine structures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 17 (1980): Proceedings of 17th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 1980.; 135
